channel.title: Comments on: New Potential Group of Orthodox Female Clergy- graduates of the GPATS
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Dennis Frengle
item.dc:creator: Dennis Frengle
item.description: A very small quibble: Gilah Kletenik is an alumna, not an alumnus.
item.content:encoded: A very small quibble: Gilah Kletenik is an alumna, not an alumnus.

item.title: By: IH
item.dc:creator: IH
item.description:
I note that she is listed under "Synagogue Officials" at KJ since her appointment (they don't seem to use the grouping "Clergy").
Lincoln Square Synagogue includes their female scholar as Clergy: http://www.lss.org/content.php?pg=Clergy&ID=96 as does the JC: http://www.jewishcenter.org/content.php?pg=Staff&ID=216
item.content:encoded:
I note that she is listed under “Synagogue Officials” at KJ since her appointment (they don’t seem to use the grouping “Clergy”).

Lincoln Square Synagogue includes their female scholar as Clergy: http://www.lss.org/content.php?pg=Clergy&ID=96 as does the JC: http://www.jewishcenter.org/content.php?pg=Staff&ID=216

item.title: By: AS
item.dc:creator: AS
item.description: In a sense this possibility for GPATS was created six or so years ago in an article by R. Michael Broyde on the parsonage exemption, where he argues for parsonage for those women functioning in the same roles as men.
item.content:encoded: In a sense this possibility for GPATS was created six or so years ago in an article by R. Michael Broyde on the parsonage exemption, where he argues for parsonage for those women functioning in the same roles as men.

item.title: By: Chakira
item.dc:creator: Chakira
item.description: Its very fascinating that we have an in house debate among the family and students of R Aharon Soloveitchik reaching such a cultural fever pitch in HuffPo, John Stewart and the Congress of the US.
item.content:encoded: Its very fascinating that we have an in house debate among the family and students of R Aharon Soloveitchik reaching such a cultural fever pitch in HuffPo, John Stewart and the Congress of the US.
